title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys Town
Interview Descriptions: HR recruiter had terrible communication and was caught in a lie about the poor communication. Didn't apologize and evaded basic questions about timelines for the position. The hiring process was incredibly too long.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time that you had to hold a staff member accountable for their actions.

title: Grant Writer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys Town (Omaha, NE)
Interview Descriptions: I went through with the interview. They never called me back after the interview to tell me a single thing - not to tell me I did not get another interview or to get the job. Not a single word.
Interview Questions: How would you describe yourself?

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys Town (Omaha, NE)
Interview Descriptions:
The whole thing was just an email from HR after I applied and then a phone interview. 

The phone interview wasn't a very good experience. The recruiter seemed annoyed the entire time like she was trying to rush me along through my answers. I could also tell she was clearly reading word-for-word from a script the entire time, not even responding to what I was saying . 

She also ended things very quickly when she was done asking questions and didn't even give me the opportunity to ask any. I wanted to know about the day-to-day, why the job is listed, what kind of projects I'd be doing, but I didn't get the chance to ask. 

Finally before she ended the call she said she'd give me an update early next week, but that update never came.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with social media?

title: In Home Family Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys Town
Interview Descriptions: I had a preliminary phone interview and then had two virtual interviews after. The first virtual was held with the person who ended up being my supervisor’s supervisor and the second interview was with my actual supervisor. Everyone was very welcoming and professional during the interview process!
Interview Questions: They asked about what superpower I would want if I could have one- I hate these types of questions!

title: Therapeutic Foster Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Boys Town
Interview Descriptions: Online verbal and written questions through an online platform. took around 35 minutes. You are given a 30 second or so time before answering the verbal questions, no video only audio.
Interview Questions: describe relevant experience working with children with behavioral issues.

title: Maintenance Mechanic Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Boys Town
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly down to earth and attention to inattention to detail when it comes to description of said position even the security stuff up front was very personable and seemed like they were really kind people
Interview Questions: Just your regular generic interview questions interviewer and I seemed to get further with the interview based off just regular conversation and experiences and then the questions given like any interview ever

title: Behavior Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys Town (Omaha, NE) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The process was fairly quick I interviewed someone from the management team and the director. The interview process typically requires a second interview but because the director was available I was able to interview in one day.
Interview Questions: Am I familiar with the PEM model?

title: Family Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Boys Town (Grand Rapids, MI) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: There are many steps involved from initial phone interviews, video interviews to going through demonstrating one's ability via a recorded exercise without understanding the full context of what and why they were requesting the exercise.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Boys Town with the youth?

title: In- Home Family Service Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys Town (Fort Pierce, FL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an application on glass door.  Someone from Hirevue called me to schedule a digital interview Boy's Town had prepared.  I answered a 30 minute series of questions both in writing and digitally on video. Still waiting to hear back.
Interview Questions: Why I would be good for the position

title: Youth Care Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys Town (Oviedo, FL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was a digital one where you're asked a stock question and given time to respond.  I actually found this harder than the face-to-face that's done for the second interview.  Not to many curve balls though, just giving you situations and looking for the most appropriate reaction.  Stay calm, describe the youth's behavior and offer more measured options and you're golden.  Second interview was more direct, practical and logistical stuff.
Interview Questions: How would you react if a youth became angry and started calling you names?

title: Youth Care Worker I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys Town (Brooklyn, NY) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great the first part was an online interview, which was great because I was able to prepare for each question and there was no pressure to make me nervous. Once I passed the second interview I was called in for a brief in person interview where I was asked questions and given scenerios of how I would react with certain situations with the teens.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a child used profanity toward you ?

title: Family Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys Town (Omaha, NE) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: After applying for the position, we heard back within 24 hours. Then we were sent the information to do our first interview two days after that. Once we'd completed the first interview (a video session), we were contacted within a couple of days to do a phone interview over a conference call. The conference call was yesterday, but we haven't heard back about it, yet! The talent acquisition agent (Brittani) was very friendly and helpful.
Interview Questions: What's one situation or behavior that would make you very uncomfortable?

title: Youth Care Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys Town
Interview Descriptions: Online video interview. They record your answers and then review them later. You have a few test tries on the answers, but it is all very quick. After the video is sent and done you will receive a phone call from HR. I received a call for a second interview in person.
Interview Questions: Do you understand the hours of this commitment?

title: Family Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boys Town (West Palm Beach, FL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is very thorough. First i was screened out by doing a video interview with hirevue. Then i passed the screening so they called me in for an interview with the family consultant supervisor. It's been a week and a half since I interviewed so I am waiting for an offer or no offer.
Interview Questions: What are 3 characteristics you think you need to have for this job?

title: Youth Care Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Boys Town (Oviedo, FL) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was an online interview. It was basically like I was recording myself answering questions. It was a little awkward at first. The question appears on screen and you have 30 seconds to think of an answer before it stars recording.
Interview Questions: How would you handle youth being disruptive and rude?

title: Family Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boys Town (Omaha, NE) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was pleasant--very casual. There was a video interview with a set of questions having to do with how you would respond to the youth  in various situations. The video was well received we thought.  The recruiter wanted us to go to the position in Omaha--we were pushing for Orange County.  A glitch with my husband came up with his past that was almost 9 years old and then the conversations were abruptly stopped.   They did not let us know why and we never thought an issue that old would hinder but it did and so there has to be a clean record completely --they tell you on the application not to put those things down.   We werent hiding anything.  We have been working with youth for years
Interview Questions: They were typical--what would you do if cooking dinner one of the youth that was on the phone became upset and started banging the phone against the wall?

title: Behavioral Health Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Boys Town (Omaha, NE)
Interview Descriptions: It was a little confusing. The interviewer didn't really describe the reward system before telling me to role play it with her. It would be more helpful to explain what the reward system is and why it is set up that way before trying to role play scenarios.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest failure so far?

title: Youth Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Boys Town (Brooklyn, NY) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was online wth a webcam. There were only questions and you have 3 minutes to answer all 15 of them. There is no person asking the questions just the computer.
Interview Questions: What can you contribute to the team?

title: Youth Care Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys Town
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a digital interview through Hirevue. Received a call for a second interview. Questions asked were why you want to work with Boys Town, are you ok with the hours, role playing, which is more important type of questions and etc.
Interview Questions: Give you an situation and you have to role play

title: Night Program Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys Town (Brooklyn, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a webcam interview and I did not like it because once you record an answer, you cannot rerecord it.  Therefore, you might not be able to give your best in one shot.
Interview Questions: If one of the youths call you names, how would you respond?

title: In Home Family Service Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys Town
Interview Descriptions: I was offered the first interview where you recorded responses to questions.
Interview Questions: Questions weren't so difficult.

title: Behavioral Health Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys Town
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received a phone call within a week. The caller on the phone asked questions about availability, experience, previous jobs, and why I wanted to work as a behavioral health tech. We set up an interview for the following week. I went to the hospital downtown for the interview. It mostly consisted of a worksheet at the beginning containing various scenarios and what I would do about them, and they gave me a job description sheet of the position. The actual interview which took place once I was done took about 45 minutes and consisted of role playing a few scenarios and more 'what would you do' questions.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you saw another employee being a little too friendly with the youth?

title: In- Home Family Service Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Boys Town (New York, NY) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: First I had a phone interview and then I got called in for an interview in the office to meet with supervisors. The interview was about an hour and a half long. The individuals who interviewed me were very nice and pleasant. The interview questions were intense.
Interview Questions: How do you handle disagreements with supervisor?

title: Youth Care Worker I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Boys Town
Interview Descriptions: I was offered the first interview in the process which was a video interview using either your phone or computer webcam. There was about 19 questions, mostly open ended some were multiple choice. They presented scenarios or general questions and you record your response with a 3 minute time slot.
Interview Questions: It was something along the lines of "If a youth were to call you a b**** how would you respond to him or her."

title: Family Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Boys Town (Boys Town, NE) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: You meet with two management-level professionals who will ask you a series of questions to determine your competency, your ability to accept feedback, and your willingness to provide the essential functions of the job. You also participate in role-plays to see how you will handle situations that may arise on the job
Interview Questions: Can you change a behavior of a kid without forst changing how they feel about the behavior?

title: Assistant Family Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys Town
Interview Descriptions: My interviewing process consisted of three interviews.  One was online, it included answering 5 questions via video recording.  The second interview was done over the phone.   I was asked questions like "What would you consider inappropriate to have on a t-shirt." The third was face to face.
Interview Questions: What would be the most uncomfortable issue/event for me to deal with.

title: Summer Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys Town
Interview Descriptions: the interview was great and cordial. the recruiter asked me my strengths, weaknesses and other personality-related questions. i had a fun time and i really felt like i was valued (which was true)
Interview Questions: non

title: Youth Care Worker I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys Town in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: first round is a phone interview. It lasted about 20 minutes. Lots of questions about your past and why you're interested in the position. Next you go in for a tour of the home, and an interview with two supervisors. They give you sample situations and ask how you would handle them.
Interview Questions: They create scenarios of youth acting out and ask how you would handle it.

title: Director of Executive Operations Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Boys Town in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: On line application process only; interview with direct supervisor; completed paperwork with HR; enrolled into first day of review of benefits and two weeks of pre-service for training.  On site training paid by employer.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Why Do You Think You Are A Perfect Fit for This Organization? Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Boys Town (New Orleans, LA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was very disorganized.  The site director did not know the hiring process, therefore the home office in Nebraska had to walk the site director's assistant through the entire hiring process.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are a perfect fit for this organization?

title: Family Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Boys Town (Omaha, NE) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and Written portion and then came in two different times for interviews with several different people. Long day and did not understand what I really was interviewing for
Interview Questions: Describe the best traits of your husband.

title: Assistant Family Teacher Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Boys Town (Omaha, NE) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an online application, and had one interview for this position. During the interview, I spoke with three people. After answering the standard questions, we did some role playing so they could see how I would react to situations I would encounter as a Boys Town employee. They were very honest about the job, and I found the interview to be a smooth and fast process.
Interview Questions: how do you handle stressful situations?

title: Assistant Family Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Boys Town in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing for the position is rigorous, where Interviewee is asked several questions related to working with children in difficult situations. Role playing is required to see how the interviewee would compose themselves in a  turbulent case scenario.
Interview Questions: Most difficult is role playing because you are looking for a right way to do it instead of the way the company sees fit. It test your ability to handle certain situations.
